result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin T Haller was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (>$2500-$5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(bf).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution and 10% surcharge - State has 60 days to determine amount and then the defendant can have 30 days after submission to request a Restitution Hearing if the amount is not agreed upon

Restitution will be paid under the terms of a payment plan to be established with the PO but calling for no less than 2.5% of gross wages to be paid toward restitution and to be enforced through a wage assignment
.

Obtain and maintain full-time employment or course of education, or a combination of both that equals full-time
.

Def is not to consume or possess any alcohol or controlled substances without a prescription from licensed physician, with random testing
.

Complete any other assessments or evaluations PO deems necessary and follow-through with any counseling or treatment recommended

Pay Crime Lab and Drug Assessment fee (see 'other' above for amount)

Cash bond of $100 will be applied to financial obligations owed - once restitution is determined.  An Assessment Report will be done when bond is applied.

Pay DOC Supervision fees

Credit for 19 days if probation is ever revoked (not to be used toward jail time)

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of resititution victims and/or govermental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt

timeConds.notes:
To be served on Electronic Monitoring with Justice Support Services
.

supervisions.notes:
To be served without release.
Cost converted to Civil Judgment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
8:45 AM - Def in court w/ Atty Jeffrey C. Mochalski.  Def in custody.  Noel A Lawrence appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
LAWRENCE: I am recommending 1 yr CJ. He has a long criminal hx.  He absconded for a long time and there was concerning behavior in this chase. MOCHALSKI: we have a plea date in this court 4/3 in the open case. LAWRENCE: the state will request a PSI and free to argue. MOCHALSKI: I already know we will do a PSI. CRT: in the rev docs there was a reference to trmt provided in a custodial setting, the rec from the DOC doesn't provide for that. MOCHALSKI: theft issues are related to sig drug issues particularly heroin. DEF: I did 16 mos w/o violations. CRT: if you don't show for testing or trmt you won't benefit. People who relapse  - that's understandable but not sympathetic to absconders or who don't show for testing, then relapse is inevitable. But it's more of a choice to con't a lifestyle. 
SENTENCE: Def sentenced to 9 mos  CJ w/ credit for 138 days to be served w/o release. Financials converted  to civil J.
  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief filed
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 15, 2017 at 08:45 am.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 13, 2017 at 09:00 am.

DOC-31 filed - signed by SLH
(not given to Probation - this is the original, an amended DOC31 was already filed & signed by CRT with the correct amounts on it)

State by Skemp /  Def w/ Atty Patricia O'Neil
Neg Plea / Plea Quest & Waiver filed
Victim Impact Stmts / Letters filed
CRT:  Victim Brian H. is husband of Dawn H. & I am familiar w/ them both - I want to make parties aware of that
O'Neil:  def has no objection to staying in this CRTRM
Def:  I want to go ahead today
Ct 2 - Def pleads GUILTY
Ct 1 - Dismissed & read-in
CRT:  Plea is FVI made - sufficient factual basis exists to support plea - CRT finds def guilty
Def wishes to proceed w/o PSI done
CRT'S SENTENCE:  Sent w/held;  Probation 18 mos w/ conditions:  30 days CJ to be served on EM thru JSS;  Def is not to possess or consume any alcohol or cont subs w/o valid prescription, w/ random testing;  Obtain & maintain full-time employment or course of education or a combination of both that is full-time;  Complete 100 hrs comm serv;  Complete any other assessments or evaluations PO deems necessary & comply w/ any counseling or trmt recommended;  Pay restitution - State has 60 days to determine amount & def can have 30 days after submission to req Hrg if def does not agree w/ rest. amt;  Pay CC & DOC fees;  Credit for 19 days if probation is ever revoked
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

11:04 am   Def in court w/ Atty Patricia L. O'Neil.  Def in custody.  Jessica Skemp appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Plea discussions.  Prelim waiver filed - signed/understands.  No promises/threats.
COURT finds the waiver of the PH is F & V made.  Bound over for trial.
Information filed - Reading waived.  Def Pleads NG - NG Pleas entered.
FEL PLEA HRG:  2/9 at 2 pm   SLH    (take 14CM-1510 off 2/2 cal)
O'Neill asks for sig. bond.  Skemp obj.
COURT comments.  $5,000 sig bond.  No contact with Jacob Sciammas and Brian Harris.  No alcohol or cont. sub w/o Rx.  JSS monitoring for testing.  Curfew 10pm - 6 am on GPA
